Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: ClareypopsEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a week over new year and stayed here, plus points are- location so near little Italy and Chinatown, great subway "F" line only 5 mins walk, friendly and helpful staff, having so much more space than a hotel room. Downside is that some parts of our accom were a bit run down ie missing tiles in bathroom and marks on walls. Overall i think it is great value 4 money. I've a great tip if you plan to spend new year, book really early as we booked in march 2011 and got the same rate for each night. When we arrived they couldn't believe we hadn't been charged the correct rate for 30 and 31 dec, which was $995 and we had paid less than $300. Try grotta assura on mulberry street, fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic and down at heel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Cathy186306
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and were directed up to our appartment supposedly for four. The kids shared a twin room whilst myself and my husband got busy trying to sort out the sofa bed in the living area. It was small and hard to put up and the sparse bedding for it made it very unwelcoming. We had three nights here and I wouldn't recommend it, however it was cheap compared to anywhere else we found.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in New york”
Reviews.Author: Samasati75
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe such spacious, apartment style accommodation could be found in such a cool location in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Beauty is in the Eye of the Beholder”
Reviews.Author: Highclasslowrent
Reviews.Content: I will give you a decent perspective on this hotel. I like it - didn't love it. My wife hated it.. We both love the location. We stayed here as the price was right. The suites are not much different from the one bedroom aprtments our friends had in Manhattan just after college. Unfortunately, we have grown beyond that. Clean me: Yes Wife: yes Spacious me: yes wife: yes Room in good condition me: It's ok but getting a bit long in the tooth. Wife: Totally unacceptable. Cheap furniture when new. Even worse now. Homey: me: not really - but serviceable wife: Awful - uncomfortable - for all the room, not enough comfortable furniture to sit on. Location: me: Great - love Little Italy and Soho Wife: Same Bottom line: - Do not expect miracles here. You are not paying for them. If I had this apartment fresh out of college, I'd have been happy. However, college was a while back and my wife and I have come to expect more. I would return to this hotel as the location is so amazing that it more than makes up for the only fair but clean rooms. However, I will not be returning except perhaps for the occasional guys weekend, as my wife will not.

Reviews.Title: “a step above a hostel -- but only a step”
Reviews.Author: FAMILY44444
Reviews.Content: We had the 2 beds only room -- it was about 8 X 8, with 12 inches between the beds and double that at the foot of the beds. Two people could stand in the room, but just barely. The window air conditioner was ancient, with a broken grill, missing knobs, etc. It was not a pleasant place. The kitchen was the lowest grade, junkiest stuff you could imagine. No coffee maker, no clock in the room Bathroom was reasonable, a decent size, and the lobby was OK too. The closest of the two subway stops was on a line that pretty much went only to Brooklyn and the financial district and the other (Grand Street. ) was more useful, but several blocks away. The neighborhood is fascinating: chic galleries next to bombed out bodegas. Its a walk to anywhere, but if you like walking (I don't) great neighborhood to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Like having a grumpy landlord!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainOver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October 2011 for three nights. The good: If you love the LES and Soho (I do), this is a great location. My wife and I stayed in a studio suite (which can accommodate up to 4), so with the kitchen and separate bedroom the stay was more like apartment than hotel living. Whole Foods is two short blocks away, making it very convenient to stock up for use of the kitchen. We booked far enough in advance to obtain a reasonable rate for this time of year. The not-so-good: You'll have to order out for service and hospitality. They were friendly enough whenever we went in and out, but whenever we had a request, we were reminded that they keep their costs down by not investing in hospitality training. We arrived shortly after 8 a.m. to check in and were immediately informed that check-in was at 3 p.m., but they could hold our bags. I asked them to please check the reservation: we had anticipated this, and had reserved an extra night, so we could have our room upon arriving after our overnight flight. They quickly recanted, but this was just the beginning of an attitude that begins with "the customer doesn't know what he/she is doing," After day one, we returned to find that neither my wife, nor my card key worked. We were admonished to keep the room keys away from our credit cards. Once again, the customer is suspect; they couldn't possibly have keyed two cards incorrectly, but both my wife and I carelessly demagnetized the room cards. We were further reprimanded for leaving the privacy sign on our door all day, which prevented us from receiving towel service that day. (I was under the impression that there were no automatic services, so I didn't think to remove the sign when we left for the day. Finally, when we requested a 1 p.m. check out, we received the automatic response that they were fully booked, and that check out time is noon - and that we should be happy with that, because 11 a.m. is the customary check out time. I reminded the attendant that we paid a full extra night, in order to check in at 8 a.m., and questioned whether asking for an extra hour on a four night stay was unreasonable - but he was not impressed. However, he graciously gave us the extra hour. The bottom line: If you get a good rate and want to indulge in the fantasy of living in an apartment on the border of LES/Soho with a grumpy landlord, then this is the place to book your experience. If you expect service with a smile, then this should not be on your list of alternative abodes. I am giving them a good review, because they don't even pretend to be service oriented, so expectations should not be high.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Emmavan
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews on this website after booking the hotel I was unsure about staying here but very pleasently surprised! The rooms and small but very comfortable - if you are out all day all you need in somewhere to sleep! Self contained so we could eat breakfast at home before leaving for the day. The staff were VERY friendly and helpful which was fantastic. And the location is perfect - 5min walk from subway stations, $15 cab ride to central park and surrounding by fabulous shopping and eating in soho and little Italy! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon G
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our stay at Off Soho. The suite was clean and roomy enough for four adults. The staff was exceptionally friendly,pleasant and helpful. The hotel was convenient to Chinatown, Little Italy,Soho and St. Marks place and an easy subway ride to other areas of the city. My only "complaint" was the mattress on the pull out sofa bed. This was a bit thin and lumpy and could use an upgrade. The kitchenette could have used a coffeemaker too.

Reviews.Title: “nice and roomy for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tessington
Reviews.Content: on a vibrant street in a colourful but pretty safe area. Nice and clean. large apartment. Air con pretty noisy but you could sleep through it. Lovely bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK CITY”
Reviews.Author: HarryL32823
Reviews.Content: CHARACTER, CHARACTER, CHARACTER. Upon arriving at OFF SOHO, after a very long flight, I was greeted by a very warm receptionist. The suite was huge, immaculate, and very comfortable. The location is to die for and within walking distance to everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to experience a true New York boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: Spirella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights at the end of a warm October 2010 together with three of my friends. We needed an affordable and comfortable place to sleep in Manhattan and we found it. Our room was big (2 single beds in one room, one sofa bed in a comfortably large living room/kitchen area) and got cleaned every day. The bedroom was on the street side, and right across the hotel is some kind of depot, so around 5 or 6 am there was a bit of noise. There was airco in the room, which was most welcome in this warm October week. We never ate in, although everything we needed was in the room: The hotel is perfectly located in the best part of manhattan: right off prince and spring, with lots of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. chinatown and litte italy are very close as well and broadway of course, which makes for a perfect location for shopping! i would return here again for the location and the comfort of the room. It might be a bit expensive though if you can't divide the room price by four but either way, this location and this kind of money...it's hard to find

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Everything”
Reviews.Author: dradow
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews pointed out, the expectation before arrival is a nice cheap hotel in a decent area. We arrived on a sketchy small street with an out of place hotel right across from a run down warehouse. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. The relative (It really isn't ) cheaper hotel cost really isn't worth it. The clerk is rude and always make excuses about not giving you the service you ask for, and is overall an unhelpful person. The hotel has nice pictures in their websites, but be warned, those clearly doesn't accurately reflect what the rooms are and the quality of it.

Reviews.Title: “Skanky - Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtoPDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Off Soho Suites, with our three kids, ages 5, 12 and 16. We were given a dank room on the ground floor, with the excuse that the extra bed we'd ordered could not be delivered to an upper floor. Perhaps rooms on higher floors are nicer, but I will never go back to find out. The entire place felt run-down and un-cared-for. Ceiling fixtures hung from rough, un-patched holes in the sheetrock. Our room was dirty - floors had a residue of dirt and dust that ruled out walking barefoot. Let's just say the bathroom was not a place one wanted to linger. When you don't even want to touch the toiletries provided, you know there's something wrong. The final straw was finding ants in the bed when I woke up. Including the extra bed charge and taxes, this room came to over $400 a night. What a rip-off. (I should add that I'm a transplanted native New Yorker, who has traveled extensively to NYC on business, and so I don't have unrealistic expectations for NY hotels or the city in general. Aside from it's good location, this hotel is not worth it.)

Reviews.Title: “Shhh.... Please keep this one a secret.”
Reviews.Author: DeRouge
Reviews.Content: I'm reluctant to write a review for this hotel, because I'm worried that if too many people find out about it, it might never be available. I've stayed here twice in the last year and would go back time after time. The location is perfect for exploring the shops in Soho and the bars and cafes in Nolita. We arrived early on the day of the blizzard, after 30hrs of travel (and our luggage being lost), and staff helped us out by giving us a room straight away. We were very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: wsimmsw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week. Arrived at around 12 midnight. The room was sparse. No comforter on the bed, the sheets seemed dirty and the blanket was filthy. Mattress was covered in body fluids probably blood and God knows what. Curtains were filthy and we got a room with a pull out couch for my two daughters. It wasn't even a pull out couch. It sagged in the middle and was filthy. Bathroom was gross. We had to spend the night because it was so late and we had been traveling for hours. They also told us on the phone that they would valet our car. Not true. We had to find a garage about 4 blocks away and walk back at midnight in the freezing cold in an area that we knew nothing about. This hotel is definitely not as advertised, seemed to be hooker palace. We payed $350 for this scummy place. We were not able to get a refund. But the manager was pleasant enough when we complained about the filth. If you want to stay at a great hotel for the same price around the same area, we moved over to the Cooper Square Hotel in Cooper Square. Everything was immaculate, they were super accomodating and the food at the restaurant was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Provided all we needed in a simple manor and let us see a real NYC”
Reviews.Author: NotoriousHAG
Reviews.Content: When we first drove down Rivington Street we all were a little concerned with what was awaiting us, especially myself who booked the accommodation for me and two friends (one male, one female) to celebrate my 30th. However, Rivington Street is a loooong street and the suites are at the nicer end. We arrived on Thanksgiving and were pleased to see a friendly face behind reception. This set the standard of the service throughout our five night stay, not at all intrusive, very relaxed but more than happy to offer advice and help when needed. Our room was on the 2nd floor, very clean, comfortable and big enough for three. The only thing it could of benefitted from was more storage for clothing, there were not enough hangers and we all ended up living out of our suitcases. The room was incredibly warm and cosy which was welcomed after the coldness of the days out, just remember that when you are putting on the layers!! We had no problems celebrating my birthday with a few friends from NYC in the room before heading out. They had storage for baggage on our last day which was most useful. The area immediatly around the accommodation is not an indication of what is on offer nearby so dont be put off, what looks like bordered up and closed shops all came alive after the thanksgiving break and we were across the road from the cool and quirky designer area of Soho, a 10 min walk from Little Italy and a nice 5-10 min walk from the nearest subway for access to uptown and downtown. Once we got our bearings we felt really comfortable, safe and happy with our choice o accommodation. Take time to look into local shops and eateries, and Broadway East is all but a 10 min walk with highstreet shops, bars and restaurants! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, simple accommodation but safe, welcoming and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Huge letdown”
Reviews.Author: kernbil
Reviews.Content: I brought my twins for their first trip to NYC for their Sweet Sixteen. I was aware that we booked a hotel a little off the beaten path, but the website made it appear cozy, if not luxurious, so I was ready for an average place. The street it's on is a disappointment, but we could overlook that, as it's convenient to Canal St. where we wanted to shop. We arrived @ 3pm, and was sent to our room with keys. The maid had just begun cleaning, and it was filthy, we had to step over bedding and such to put our luggage down. Spoke to the front desk to tell them, and they said "oh, it's ok" ( really? not ok with ME!) We got back and the bedroom that was advertised with two queens, had two twins, no TV and no bureaus. We asked for a cot ( I had 3 teens with me) had to ask twice. I slept in the pull out, in the living area..........literally it's a wooden board with maybe a 1/2" padding, like sleeping on the floor. No sleep for me, and a 4:30 am a rowdy crowd made it impossible to try any further. Upon asking for another cot so I could maybe sleep one night, they sent a maid with bedspreads for padding. Back to the front desk, and told him, he called the maid stupid. The help seems afraid of the managers, sad. He told me to follow him to the basement ( after me literally begging) and pointed to a cot that was folded, and said " here, take this, hurry, I don't want a headache" I had to wheel it to my room on the second floor, but at this point I was grateful. After the first night I had to have someone come sweep the girls bedroom because my daughter got glass in her foot, and fine shards were everywhere on the floor. I had to wipe grimy finger prints off of stained walls. Light bulbs were out, and it's really outdated. Next day, no maid service, but she had taken our towels, and not replaced them. Had to call front desk again. Also asked if they provided tissues..nope. No ammonites at all. This was a huge letdown, and I would never recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Met my average expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bigcityeater
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews i was not expecting a lot and the hotel did match my expectations. The reason we chose the hotel was because it was located a couple of blocks from where we were meeting a group of people but the area especially Rivington street itself is not that nice. We had a "Suite" and the bedroom itself was sparse with no TV. On the bright side the bed was comfortable and the front desk staff was pleasant but would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel like you're in New York, stay here”
Reviews.Author: sbendpassport
Reviews.Content: O.K. I'll be honest, I tried to find a hotel in the SoHo area that would be cost friendly for me & my 13 year old daughter for her first trip into this city. I researched many places and kept coming back to this one as many of the reviewers were very happy with the location and the price. Perhaps I need to dig a little deeper into the reviews but no one seems to mention the BAR next door to this hotel and the bottles breaking and people talking and traffic of people walking by the hotel as you are woken up at 4:00 a.m by all the noise. There are also many bars up and down Rivington, the street which this hotel sits, and as we stayed there Thursday night through a Sunday, the traffic of people was often, loud and to be honest, obnoxious & rude. Our bedroom faced Rivington, so perhaps that was the issue. We had a two twin bedroom room with the small but adequate kitchen/sofa room and off of that, a bathroom. It is very nice to have a refrigerator and place to hang out and my daughter really like this aspect. However, I did not like the surroundings at all-I guess it was too "urban" for me, though I have spent over a decade in downtown Chicago and have never come across something quite like this. I really can't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, but canÂ´t recommend it. You have to search again.”
Reviews.Author: Bolotet
Reviews.Content: Before you arrive to Off Soho Suites, you are expecting a nice apartment in a nice neighbourhood, close to everything. Before you arrive, you are thinking, I made the right choice, this is not a bad price compare to other hotels in New York, specially if you are a group of 4 people. Well, we were a group of 4 people and all of us expected the same, but sorry, dreams don't come true. 2 people will sleep ok, the other 2 wonÂ´t sleep at all. Sofa bed is quite uncomfortable and the worst part is the noise coming from the Air Conditioning devices just outside your window. I tried with diferent ear-plugs, but non of them worked. Yes this is true, New York is the city that never sleeps, specially if you stay here. If you are hard sleeper, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great option for groups”
Reviews.Author: student_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at OffSoho with a group of 5 people and it was fantastic. We are students so we crammed into the two twin beds and futon couch. It kind of had a hostel-esque feel, but obviously way nicer. We were out late every night and never experienced problems getting back in or bringing people to our room. The staff are so nice and friendly. By the end of our four night stay, they knew all of our names and were very helpful. It is so clean I don't know what some people are talking about. Its in a great location close to 2 subway stations. It provided us with a lot of freedom. Don't go there expecting maid service, go there expecting privacy. The kitchenette made travelling on a tight student budget perfect for New York. I'm definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location for family travel”
Reviews.Author: rockriverbob
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, clean, spacious option at a fantastic price in an amazing location for lower Manhattan. I urge you not to pay attention to the reviews that say it's dirty (it's not) or hot and noisy (the a/c was fine in the hottest month ever). My wife and I enjoyed the double bed; our son had the couch and we rented a roll-away for our daughter. We did not cook but the kitchen was fine. The suite is spacious and comfortable for four people. And it's New York so you're not there much! The hotel is close to a subway and easy walking to SoHo shopping and attractions; the Lower East Side; and up Broadway. Tons of great restaurants, the Tenement Museum nearby. What's not to like here??

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the buzz”
Reviews.Author: NatandDrac
Reviews.Content: I''d heard that New York hotels offered small rooms at high prices so I looked for an alternative and found Off Soho Suites. While I would say that calling them 'suites' is a bit of a stretch I do think the rooms are spacious and clean. The staff are friendly and helpful but most of all walking out the door puts you right in the heart of Soho, one of the coolest, trendiest places in the world. Cafes, bars and fantastic restaurants are right at your door step ... we loved our time there and would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good place at a good price in the greatest of cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, quality was as expected”
Reviews.Author: rowuncw
Reviews.Content: I recently visited New York with a group of friends and we needed a place that would come out to less than $300 per couple per night, AND offer sleeping arrangements for each person (i.e. nobody sleeping on the floor). There are very few suite options in New York within our budget, and Off Soho Suites is one of them. I was particularly excited about the location in a neighborhood near Chinatown and Canal Street. This provided for a more â€œlocalâ€� New York experience in an area with lots of character and not a ton of tourists. The Grand Street and Bowery subway stations are just a short walk from the hotel. Upon arrival at Off Soho, our reservation was readily available and there was no problem checking in. The room we reserved for the weekend was a deluxe suite for four, with an extra person (we were provided with a roll-away cot). The room included a small kitchen equipped with pots, pans, cups, coffee mugs, and silverware, a bedroom with two twin beds, and a living area with a table, coffee table, and pull-out sofa. The room itself was a tight squeeze for our group and it was difficult at times to move around. However, I found it adequate for our needs. We didnâ€™t visit New York to spend our time in the hotel room. The building was obviously older, but the room and waiting areas seemed to have been recently remodeled. The paint on the walls was clean, the floors were shiny and clean, and the bathroom was in decent shape. Overall, the condition of the room was acceptable and nothing was broken or falling apart, including in the bathroom. Sleeping in the room was a little uncomfortable. This was due in part because we had a group of people and also because the beds and the fold-out couch were somewhat uncomfortable. However, I do not consider this a negative given the price and purpose of the hotel in general. I did not find the room particularly noisy, especially for a busy city. We rarely encountered other guests and never heard any noise or commotion from other rooms or from the hallway. To wrap up, my expectations of the Suites were tempered by the fact that it was a budget hotel that is advertised as a â€œhotel alternativeâ€�. I was not expecting plush beds, soundproof walls, or an enormous space. As a result, I was very pleased with my experience at Off Soho Suites. The rooms were livable, the service was standard, and the location was unbeatable for a true New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: getawayplans
Reviews.Content: I was unsure what I was getting myself into when I booked a shared room. Turned out to be a great decision. The shared room was once a 2 bedroom apartment, so even though our room was small ( 2 single beds with about 20" between the beds, closet, safe) having an entrance hall, large washroom and full kitchen made us feel like we were in our own apartment (and by NYC standards a large one at that). We stayed for 3 nights, and only ran into our roommates once. Common space was cleaned daily, the entire hotel was very clean. Location is amazing! Google it. Front Desk always had someone on duty, and they were very helpful with any questions we had. I will be staying here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accom at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: paulainoz
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk to Soho shops and restaurants, we found this accom good value for money and easily catered for three people. Spacious with a good size bathroom and comfy beds. Were in a room with 2 singles and a fold out couch. As 3 women, we felt safe walking in the area at night and the staff were friendly and helpful. Loved shopping in Nolita and Soho, especially along Broadway. Handy to have a pub next door for drinks before heading out for dinner or late at night. Would stay here again because of the price but if you want to be a bit closer to the action, perhaps look at being a bit further west over Bowery. The surrounding area is not real pretty, I think it's Little Italy, but if you don't mind a bit of walking it's not far to subway and shops.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Aede
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends for 3 nights in one of the deluxe suites, room 405, and we were more than happy with the hotel. Friendly staff, clean hotel, spacious rooms which were bright and warm, very comfy beds, good shower, and incredibly very quiet, (we had a room to the rear). The location was fantastic, I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but don't trust the promises”
Reviews.Author: devexit
Reviews.Content: The property is typical for that part of the Manhattan. Everything is old, but clean in general. We requested 2 dbl beds in the bedroom. the double beds were very narrow. So the children have to sleep on a sofabed. The sofa was in bad shape, filthy and the "mattres" was very flat. I had to force my children to sleep on it. Service; the person at the reception was polite, but not very attending for service requests. I was left with the feeling "Hard cheese, you are booked here for one night and I have already had my money". One example: Th receptionist was very eager to offer "limousine" service to the airport. The price in inroom brochyre was 50 $, but the person was telling us the price to be 55 $. I told him about this and mentioned that the flat rate to the JFK is usually 45 $. After this we agreed on 45 $. Later, when it was time to leave for the airport, the price was up to 55 $ again. I am not saying that this is a big deal, but it discribes the service attitude of the hotel. I do recommend this hotel with conditions. Be prepared to take 40 - 60 procent off from their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cute, cold...and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelStar
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking for a different hotel in the area when I stumbled across this adorable hotel. I was in NYC for one night and needed somewhere to lay my head during the terrible winter storm that was approaching. I checked into a single room which actually contained two single beds (forgot to take pictures). The room I received was a room within a suite I had to share with another occupant, who I never met while there...a little weird, but I got over it...I'm a college student. The suite was big and reminiscent of a small NYC apartment also with many of the amenities of most hotels (iron, iron board, towels..). The bathroom, although shared with the other occupant, was big. The kitchen within the suite was equipped with: a large refrigerator, a toaster, a microwave, sink and drain board, plenty of cupboards, and a full use stove. The room had a small flat screen TV attached to the wall with basic cable channels. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff were friendly. So far so good, right? My only complaints were that the rooms were kind of brisk during the winter day and the blankets they provided weren't doing the trick. When I mentioned it to the front desk, I was informed the hotel used central air and the heat would come on automatically. It didn't. Secondly, it seemed like I could hear everyone's footsteps in the entire hotel against the hardwood floors while I tried to sleep. It was almost unbearable. But this is NYC, I expected a little noise. Other than that, this is a cute little place to stay when visiting the city. It's close to Chinatown, Little Italy, and subway lines. The amount I paid considering the location and service was nice as well. I could see this as a place to stay during long visits to the area because of the comfort it provides with it's apartment style rooms. I would stay here again, but maybe in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, and Staff”
Reviews.Author: danj
Reviews.Content: Off Soho had a mistake on its website about a rate. I called just to confirm instead of just booking on the site. The employee who answered swore it must have been a mistake but brought up the website to double check to see if what I saw was right. He saw the price I saw and honoured it on the 4 person suite. Automatically that swayed me into thinking this hotel had great customer service. We showed up early for check-in due to a tough drive/train ride into town and not being able to use up enough time after arriving due to really windy weather, cold, tired, and carrying a backpack. The staff didn't have a problem with us showing up 2 hours before check-in (not that I'd always suggest this though) and our room was ready. The hotel itself is compact and understandably so. I wasn't expecting wide open corridors with mile high ceilings. It was clean, fashionable, bright, and, comfortable. Upon arrival into the room it was a bit worn but large, very large actually, and well put together. One complaint is the couch/extra bed. It looks good but it is not practical or all that comfortable. Each of us had a hard time finding a comfortable position while relaxing between ventures out into the city. The bathroom, like the rest of the room was large too. The toilet warning sign means what it says. It is very low flow and don't try to flush too much TP in a sitting, give a lil and flush, and then go for another flush which kinda defeats the point of a low flow if you gotta flush a few times. The shower had great pressure and heat but both were a tad difficult to control at first. The room we had was easy to control some fresh air rather than use the AC. Overall, I think this hotel has a great location as it is close to several subway stops, many delicious restaurants, bars, and music venues. It's very close to Chinatown and Little Italy as well. I'd book here again even at a regular rate but was glad the staff gave me the rate listed on the website. That went a long way for me. I'd actually have to say that the biggest complaint was the internet available. It was slow and not very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great price-location ratio, good service.”
Reviews.Author: AndersReve
Reviews.Content: Got a tip about this place for a budget Manhattan hotel. And in deed it is. Service was excellent, the personel was very polite and meeting, and the beds was made up almost everyday with fresh towels. The room was worn, but OK. LARGE rooms, but the 2 man luxury is exactly the same room as the 4 person suite. Plenty of space, and not to shabby. In fact a little better then what you would expect at the pricerange. (We stayed 4 people in one room for 329 dollars a night!) Location is superb! Walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy, Bleecker Street and of course the Soho area for all the great underground live venues etc etc. Several subway stations nearby. Would use this hotel again in a heartbeat, even if I wasnt on a budget. Youre in Manhattan, New York, time is not spent in the hotelroom unless you are some sort of drag, boring person. PS: Very short beds, if you are more than 185cm, be prepared to sleep with your toes outside the matrass.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: nightowlgrantwriter
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about how great off-Soho suites is -- but the best part was the friendliest service behind the desk. thanks Ewad and Gabe!

Reviews.Title: “A new experience - Off Soho Suites”
Reviews.Author: femininenadia
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to avoid dining on restaurant food all day long, this place is ideal. Located in close proximaty to all amenities and attractions, this one bedroom suite was relatively spacious given the standard size of what's typically offered in New York City. It was clean, modern and equipped with dishware, pots, pans, cutlery etc. The front desk and housekeeping staff were all very friendly and accomodating. I would definitely stay there again while visiting the Big Apple! ** The only downfall is that the rooms have hardwood floors so, if you sleep lightly, be sure to pack earplugs :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, decent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RRGill
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget place to stay for a spur of the moment trip to NY. Off Soho Suite doesn't pretend to have 5* service or full hotel facilities - what they offer is an affordable clean room at a good price. Our appartment was fine for what we needed it for - basically somewhere to sleep inbetween hitting the town. Beds were comfy - the sofa bed was great. The staff were polite and very helpful. I see people leaving a lot of negative comments about the lack of facilities but lets face it if you want all the whistles and bells then don't be so cheap and go for a 4 or 5* hotel and leave these suites for the people who can appreciate what they have to offer! The area is a little strange with all the kitchen equipment suppliers but again if you want to stay in the middle of the action there are so many hotels you can go to. For me the location was great 10 mins on the subway will pretty much take you whereever you need to go. Keep up the good work guys - I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: geomcc36
Reviews.Content: I tell everyone about Off SoHo Suites!!! I have stayed there a number of times and its the only place I will stay in NYC. The rooms are big, beds are great. Easy to get anywhere in NYC from the Hotel. Very Charming

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: MadameBravado
Reviews.Content: My husband I are in New York frequently for business and pleasure and usually we stay with friends. This time we decided to get a room for the weekend and were lucky enough to come across the Off Soho Suites. The price was beyond reasonable, but that's the least of my praise. We were given a beautifully decorated apartment-like suite that was clean, posh, romantic and comfortable. From the style to the ammenities, everything was inviting. The desk staff was friendly and efficient. Don't pass this place by!

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: zhermann
Reviews.Content: i stayed here a couple years ago and the best part of the hotel is the location (tucked in btwn Soho and the Lower East side) and the price... overall this is a great hotel for the budget conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TDK_9
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I took a shopping trip to NY before Christmas and stayed in a 2 bed (1 sofa bed) suite on the 6th floor. It was absolutely perfect for us - brilliant location, right beside the restaurants and pubs of Little Italy & Soho and very close to the high street shops on Broadway. Our rooms were fantastic, very clean and excellant facilities (TV, kitchenette). The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I think our suite had been recently renovated, so you may want to check when booking on the type of room you are reserving. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Sephuzzy
Reviews.Content: They call themselves the "Traveler's alternative to New York's overpriced, undersized hotel rooms," which is exactly what it is: overpriced and undersized, PLUS super noisy, dirty, and unfriendly. an absolute NO GO! never again ... it was so bad, we were happy to leave New York.

Reviews.Title: “Full refund even though I canceled at 4:30 pm Friday July 4.”
Reviews.Author: SiegfriedNYC
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay here, great location, made reservation with credit card for Friday July 4. at last minute I couldn't go, at 4:30 on that very same day. hotel gave me full refund! helpful staff. I will stay there any time I need a NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Horsecat
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a stay with 3 friends at Off Soho Suites in New York and had a great time. The apartment was clean and spacious, and the staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms don't get throughly cleaned every day but the bins are emptied, the bathroom is cleaned and the towels are changed which is fine but a change of sheets would have been nice - although I'm sure the staff would've provided us with more if asked. I've been to New York a few times and I liked this location. It looks like there is nothing there at first sight but just go a couple streets either side and there are lots of great shops, bars and places to eat. Yes you could stay somewhere like Times Square but it's nice to be in a quieter, less hectic touristy area which prompts you to explore more of NY and it's easy to get to places like Times Square anyway. I couldn't recommend this place more. It's a good price and has every thing you need and I will definitely be using this place again on my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Fleabag”
Reviews.Author: millworkinstaller
Reviews.Content: Payed 329 a night for a dump, Asked why the beds were not made and was told "its like an apartment and we don't clean the rooms daily"- (only new towels). What a crock! Twin beds were hard as rock, sleep sofa did not pull out.Quality of room was very poor- should be hit with a wrecking ball. Noisy,grungy part of town-"the used kitchen equipment district"Stay away from this place at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: modynes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with 3 other girls. We were on a break from the uk from the thursady to the monday and soho offered us exactly what we needed. Cheap accomodation. People complain about the surrounding area but we were not there to walk around we were sightseeing and shopping so spent very little time at the apartment. The room had 2 single beds that could not be pushed together ( no sneaking another person in) and the living area had a bed sette that was not the most comfortable but you get what you pay for. The kitchen had 4 of everything you needed and the bathroom was clean and spacious. the only problem we encountered was the taxi drivers trying to con you do not let them sit with a map and question them if you think they are wrong. from macys it should cost approx 10$ max. Subway is just around the corner and easy to use. we booked a 6 excursion pass online and it was worth it. We also visited woodbury commen outlet again booked through grays online. It was good but not as many savings as orlando. macys has fab sales so saved more there. Staff at the apartment very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time & very pleased”
Reviews.Author: BriskGo
Reviews.Content: They can arrange to have limo service from JFK, makes it easy to get to & return from, had a nice suite on the first floor, only thing I would have asked for was a tv in the bedroom too, oh, and wash clothes. But we brought our own washclothes because we stayed here before! had a great time, convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, staying again”
Reviews.Author: NYC4everLancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Off Soho Suites last September , loved it - the location is fantastic .... 10 mins walking distance away from anywhere , Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, LES. Subway one block away that takes you anywhere . This was our 5th visit to New York and have always stayed Midtown , will definitely stay in this location again, so much so we're going back in April and staying at Off Soho again. If you want hotel room service and a bar and restaurant on hand it's not the place for you , if you want a comfortable place to stay which is like having your own apartment in NYC this is it !!! Whole Foods a couple of blocks away, Spring Street, Bowery, East Houston all 2 mins walk , restaurants galore from every type of cuisine known ..... friendly helpful staff ... great value limo service

Reviews.Title: “location and pice...Fab!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDonna
Reviews.Content: Before we went I read all the reviews and I was a little concerned. Noisy, ants in the rooms.... Our experience was wonderful. The suite was roomy, clean and very quiet. 10 minute walk to Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown. The neighbourhood has many great restaurants but wait times are an hour or so on weekends. The Clinton Street Bakery for breakfast, Stanton Social for dinner. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful and very unobtrusive. It really felt like our own apartment for the three days we stayed. I'd go back for sure. $200.00 a night in New York is unheard of, especially considering the location of Off-Soho Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Off SOHO Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: rogcol04
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 years ago with my husband (fiance at the time) and our two friends for new years eve in times square. I booked this hotel about 4 mos in advance thinking it was close to the times square action on new years but it isnt. Anyway, the suite was large, definetly accomodating enough for four adults. It was a little unkempt.....I felt the need to walk around the room with socks on because the floor looked kinda dirty. my husband and I slept in a twin bed in the bedroom that squeaked and was hard and our friends slept in a pull out sofa in the living room. Full kitchen that we didn't use but it seemed good enough if we were going to use it...... bathroom was large...... staff was friendly and helpful. There was a yummy brick oven pizza place about 2 blocks away, don't remember the name, and for breakfast we ate a good breakfast at a nice deli, sorry, don't remember the name either. In closing, this place was decent enough for the price. the staff definetly gets an E for EFFORT, the maids are always walking around with their cleaning carts and everyone seems friendly and eager to please and make you happy. If you want cheap place to lay your head and comfort isn't too much of a necessity, than off soho may be your place!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for tiny”
Reviews.Author: Solitairey
Reviews.Content: Our room was so small that it took a half-hour to try to place our luggage so we could squeeze into bed. We knew there was a shared bath, but were not prepared, based on the descriptions, for bedding down in what was essentially a closet. After two days, we moved into the adjoining room, where we could at least access the beds without too much problem. The biggest problems we had were with the advertising of the place . Master bedroom should read master closet, remodeled means only the downstairs lounge. Wireless access means that you have to pay for it (altho there are so many unprotected wireless accounts nearby that you can probably log onto one of them). We were told that room cleaning would be $25/day extra. We had to beg for towels and soap. Someone smoked in the room next to us, and it didn't seem to concern management too much. The guys at the desk are nice, but what you are paying for here is the location. Walk out the door and you are in the middle of Soho, with restaurants every 20 feet. But the place is small and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and smoky”
Reviews.Author: mdavenport
Reviews.Content: The only hotel I've ever stayed at where they have ashtrays and matches provided on the coffee table. The room, though very large, reeked of smoke, as did the hallway, especially since a coed group of about 10 russians 20-somethings were using the adjacent two rooms as their home base. They ran in and out, slamming the door, every ten minutes for most of the evening. Cheap-ass furniture, skimpy-ass bath towels. No shampoo. I asked they guys at the front desk, and they acted surprised that I had expected shampoo. They pointed me toward a nearby drugstore. Location is great, which is the only redeeming quality. Directly next door is the excellent, friendly German bar/restaurant Lorlei. Across the street is the on-the-scene restaurant Freemans, where I literally ran into Matthew Broderick while heading out the door after eating there. Quite close to Nolita and Soho action.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family stay at reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: SCashCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights here this past week. The hotel was really more like an apartment building. We rented a room with 2 double beds in the bedroom and a futon (at least a queen, if not a king size!) in the living room. Althought it was small, it was perfect for a reasonable price. Reservations and check in were easy - I normally stick to chain hotels, so I was a bit nervous, but everything went smooth. Some things someone considering this hotel should know: 1. There are 3 subway stops located close by that are very convenient, and from there you can get almost anywhere. 2. There is a restaurant/bar right next door that has an outdoor seating area in the back that you may hear through your windows. In our suite, only the bedroom had an air conditioner, so those sleeping in the living room may need to open the windows, and thus will hear the bar noise. I am a very light sleeper, but I was sufficiently exhausted every night after touring Manhattan, and it didn't bother me. In the bedroom, with the air on, you can't hear it at all. I'm not sure, but I would guess those with windows facing to the front of the buiding will hear the smoker's crowd out front. 3. There are laundry facilities in the basement - $2 per load, per machine. The dryers don't work well, and there is no change machine, so bring your own quarters as the front desk staff doesn't have change either. There are 3 washers (one was out of order) and two dryers. 4. The neighborhood, to those who aren't familiar with NYC, may look rough - the buildings on the street and in the area are full of grafitti. I never felt unsafe at all. It may look bad, but it's really not. 5. The kitchen comes equipped with a microwave, 4 burner stove/oven, fridge, dishes (plates, bowls, small glasses, coffee cups, and silverware) for 4, one pot, one pan, a tea pot, a strainer, a bottle opener/corkscrew, a large serving spoon, and a pancake turner. No towels, paper or otherwise are supplied for the kitchen. No sponge or soap for the kitchen is supplied. No coffee maker. There is only one ice tray, so we started putting the ice in the strainer to keep up with our needs - 5 people need ore than 12 pieces of ice! 6. There are a number of small stores in the area for food supplies - but many of them close before 6pm. 7. Maid service is available for an extra $15 (not sure if that's per day or total, since we didn't use it). The only service you will receive is fresh (very very thin and small) bath towels (no hand or face) daily, trash removal, toilet paper, and soap. The suite itself was very clean. 8. There is a very nice gym, with nice equipment, but it is in the basement, so therefore not very well ventilated. 9. There is also a lounge that is spacious and faces the street on the ground floor - good for people watching! 10. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They will greet you each and every time they see you, and will answer your questions. When I checked out, I mentioned that I had a great stay, except the last night there was a group of probably 8 young men who checked in and had several rooms on several floors. They were running back and forth between rooms, up and down the stairs, slamming doors and shouting. I finally went out at 3:30am after 2 hours of this and asked them to be quiet, which they did except for the door slamming thing. The guy at the front desk said all I had to do was call him and he would have taken care of it, and I believe that. So, all in all, not a Hyatt or a Sheraton, just a small apartment style hotel on the edge of SOHO, Chinatown, and Little Italy that is clean and safe, and reasonable. I am very pleased. Whoops! I forgot the most important thing - the beds! Our double beds in the the bedroom were brand new - still had the IKEA tags hanging off the frames. They were comfortable - but be aware that the AC is right next to the foot of one of them. We just directed the vent up and it wasn't a problem, and was nice white noise. The futon bed in the living room is very large, and quite firm. It was new, a leather covered two piece foam thing. One side is slightly softer than the other, and the hotel didn't seem to have a fitted sheet large enough for it, so we ended up using a flat sheet for the bottom and just pinning the sheet under the legs to hold it on. I like hard mattresses, and this one has very little give - perfect! The pillows were okay - they had some kind of covering on them that didn't let the air out of them very easily so they were overly poofy for my tastes and took a long time to smoosh down.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: OlafR
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews on NY hotels before we made a reservation at Off Soho. We needed a suite style room for four with a seperate bedroom for two (the kids) in a good manhattan location with multiple subway connections at a reasonable price. What was left after this search was more or less this hotel. The reservation process and checkin procedere was problem-free, staff was friendly and helpful with luggage storage and limo service after checkout. The room didn't have the latest furniture, but - hey - at this price in that location, our expectations were not that high. Despite the age of the interior and furniture, everything was perfectly clean and worked properly (we didnt use the aircon). The hotel has 3 or four different subway lines in walking distance and a very good food mart. Our expectations were fully met, we have nothing to complain and can recommend this hotel to other tourists.

HotelInfo.Name: Off Soho Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Rivington Street, New York City, NY 10002
